sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations using Cramer's rule:

2x + 3y - z = 5

4x - 2y + 3z = 0

5x + y - 2z = 11
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix (D), and then the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing the columns with the constants (Dx, Dy, Dz). Finally, we will find the values of x, y, and z by dividing the determinants of the matrices by the determinant of the coefficient matrix.

The coefficient matrix is:

| 2  3 -1 |
| 4 -2  3 |
| 5  1 -2 |

To find the determinant of the coefficient matrix (D):

D = 2((-2)(-2) - (3)(1)) - 3((4)(-2) - (3)(5)) - 1((4)(1) - (5)(-2))
D = 2(4 - 3) - 3(-8 - 15) - 1(4 + 10)
D = 2(1) + 3(23) + 1(14)
D = 2 + 69 + 14
D = 85

Now, we will find the determinants of the matrices obtained by replacing the columns with the constants.

For Dx, replace the first column with the constants:

| 5  3 -1 |
| 0 -2  3 |
|11  1 -2 |

Dx = 5((-2)(-2) - (3)(1)) - 3((0)(-2) - (3)(11)) - 1((0)(1) - (11)(-2))
Dx = 5(4 - 3) - 3(0 - 33) + 1(0 + 22)
Dx = 5(1) + 3(33) + 22
Dx = 5 + 99 + 22
Dx = 126

For Dy, replace the second column with the constants:

| 2  5 -1 |
| 4  0  3 |
| 5 11 -2 |

Dy = 2((0)(-2) - (3)(11)) - 5((4)(-2) - (3)(5)) - 1((4)(11) - (5)(5))
Dy = 2(0 - 33) - 5(-8 - 15) + 1(44 - 25)
Dy = -66 + 5(23) + 1(19)
Dy = -66 + 115 + 19
Dy = 68

For Dz, replace the third column with the constants:

| 2  3  5 |
| 4 -2  0 |
| 5  1 11 |

Dz = 2((-2)(11) - (0)(1)) - 3((4)(11) - (0)(5)) + 5((4)(1) - (5)(-2))
Dz = 2(-22 - 0) - 3(44 - 0) + 5(4 + 10)
Dz = -44 - 132 + 5(14)
Dz = -44 - 132 + 70
Dz = -106

Now, we will find the values of x, y, and z by dividing the determinants of the matrices by the determinant of the coefficient matrix:

x = Dx / D = 126 / 85
y = Dy / D = 68 / 85
z = Dz / D = -106 / 85

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 126/85
y = 68/85
z = -106/85
